citeinfo.title: Scanning Multichannel Microwave Radiometer (SMMR)

abstract.p: Microwave brightness temperatures are binned to the SSM/I (Special Sensor Microwave/Imager) 25 km northern hemisphere grid. First CD-ROM in the series covers 29 October 1978 - 31 January 1980; data for remainder of the sensor life (through August 1987) will be mastered on CD-ROM; please inquire for current availability. Grids for the southern hemisphere will be mastered after completion of the northern hemisphere. CD-ROM follows the ISO 9660 industry standard and is compatible with the MS-DOS and VMS operating systems. Software package to access and display data is provided on diskette. Inquiries for detailed information on content, format, hardware/software requirements, and references should be directed to the contact person listed above. Brightness temperature data will also be available on standard 9-track magnetic tape, but costs will be higher than if delivered on CD-ROM. Data consists of 665 Mbytes on CD-ROM for the Northern Hemisphere, Volume One.
[Reference: Comiso, J.C., and H,J, Zwally (in press). Polar Microwave Brightness Temperatures from Nimbus-7 SMMR: Time Series of Daily and Monthly Maps from 1978 to 1987: NASA Technical Memorandum.]
